# FlatPDF

> A flat, zero-dependency PHP PDF writer built for speed and large documents.

FlatPDF writes PDF operators directly — no HTML parsing, no CSS engine, no external binaries. It is designed for table-heavy reports with hundreds or thousands of rows.

- Package: `pdfparse/flatpdf`
- Requires: PHP 8.2+
- License: MIT
- Docs: https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/

## Docs

- [Getting Started](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/getting-started): Installation, quick start, `FlatPdf::make()` factory
- [Text & Headings](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/text-and-headings): `h1()`, `h2()`, `h3()`, `text()`, `bold()`, `italic()`, `code()`, `hr()`, `space()`
- [Tables](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/tables): `table()` with auto-sizing columns, alignment, striping, page-break headers, `summaryRow()`
- [Data Tables](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/data-tables): `dataTable()` for associative arrays and Eloquent collections with formatters
- [Images](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/images): `image()`, `imageFromString()`, `imageFromDisk()` — JPEG only
- [Style & Configuration](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/style-and-configuration): `Style::make()` with presets (`a4()`, `compact()`, `landscape()`, `landscapeCompact()`)
- [Page Control](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/page-control): `pageBreak()`, `getRemainingSpace()`, `getCurrentPage()`, headers/footers
- [Output Methods](https://flatpdf.pdfparse.co/output-methods): `save()`, `output()`, Laravel responses, S3 uploads, compression

## Full docs

For the complete API reference with all code examples, see [llms-full.txt](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pdfparse/flatpdf/main/llms-full.txt).
